intro: Androsace adfinis, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine meadows and scree slopes. Due to its delicate structure, it is adapted to cold climates and is often used in rock gardens.
